tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Keating
programme.desc: The Keating prime ministership: covering the road to a Republic, repointing the continent to Asia, the Redfern Speech and embracing Mabo; compulsory superannuation and blowing budget surpluses to climb out of recession.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa Georgiadis decorates his beard for Canberras Floriade; Jerry Coleby-Williams gets the low-down on growing passionfruit; Tino Carnevale visits a Gondwana-themed garden and Millie Ross visits a garden designer at home.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts are in Herefordshire at Hampton Court Castle near Leominster. Amongst the family treasures under scrutiny are an important record of the days of early photography and a collection of jade.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: A fake mosque proposal duped the media, exposing how little fact-checking was done. Satirical news site The Betoota Advocate laugh all the way to the bank with cheeky sponsored content. Thanks to eagle-eyed tipsters. (Final)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: At long last, it is Stephen Fry and the QI Long Lost show. With Suggs, Claudia ODoherty, Jimmy Carr and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson has Hard Quiz questions for those who covet his Big Brass Mug. This weeks contestants are experts on King Gizzard and the Lizard Wizard, Mario Kart, The X-Files, and concrete!

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.sub-title: The truth about Chinas social credit scores
programme.desc: Myf and Alan take the show by the horns, literally! Theyre joined by the grudge-holding MC Suffa, Jem Cassar-Daley, Peter Helliar and Denise Scott. Spiderbait close with a ramming and jamming performance of Black Betty.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: The ABS releases its first full monthly inflation figures. Kirsten Aiken and The Business team break it all down with reaction and analysis from economists and the market.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Leaked Ukraine peace plan confuses allies and emboldens Russia. Is this the death knell for Ukraine? Plus as MAGA devotee Marjorie Taylor Greene quits Congress, does Trump have a new bestie in Zohran Mamdani? (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The parliamentary sitting week continues with coverage of Question Time from the Senate.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa Georgiadis meets a designer who sees beauty in imperfection, Millie Ross builds a no-dig vegie bed, Josh Byrne explores the plants of WAs ironstone ranges, and Jerry Coleby-Williams meets sub-tropical rose growers.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Piano UK
programme.desc: In Glasgow Central Station the lineup includes local jazz legend Stanley, an 86-year-old father of eleven; an Elton John playing YouTube star; and a boogie woogie biker with blood on her hands.

programme.title: Parliament Question Time
programme.desc: The last Question Time for the parliamentary year. Coverage from the House of Representatives. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Psychologist Paul North has employed his son Josh to take on the task of building a bullet proof earth berm house, deep in New South Wales Yass Valley, to protect them from bushfires and the extremes of climate change.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Donny the Pony becomes a monster, not a unicorn.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Chris finds himself in an uncomfortable spot as he goes head-to-head with Dr Xand in a man v monkey contest to show you the power of your pelvis!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Spoiled Sports Day
programme.desc: At the sports carnival, Kyle loses his temper when he doesnt win a race, but Maudie suspects there might be more to Kyles unexpected loss.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai helps Bell track down stolen nerfs.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer receives a huge electricity bill and decides to build his own wind turbine to power the farmhouse.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Prepare to meet your bodys enormous, explosive, energy storage system your liver! And join Lilia for an amazing operation on her brain.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven joins an underground wrestling league with Amethyst, who is tired of Pearl and Garnet bringing her down.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: When a vendor at the Farmers Market sticks Panda with an EpiPen reviving him after an allergic reaction, Panda comes in to the arms of his dream girl. Panda tries to woo this woman of his dreams.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Louis and Jessica decide to open Cattlemans Ranch on Thanksgiving Day, inspiring Emery and Evan to get into the restaurant business. Meanwhile, Jessica takes action when Eddie decides to blow off the rest of eighth grade.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, Gem shares her top tips for beginners to get a big head start in the dangerous shrunken world of Grounded. Plus, Dr Deviser returns for more devious experiments in his Create-a-Character challenge!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When Bubbles gets the lead in the school play, Blossoms jealousy consumes her.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors are Ouch and About ready for your medical questions, and Dr Xand turns fire juggler to reveal your secret sense - proprioception. But will Chris notice that somethings up?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Exciting Excursion
programme.desc: The Grade Five rock climbing excursion is jeopardised when the permission slips go missing, but Maudie suspects they may have been hidden on purpose.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Lys sets out to find a rare creature.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer has caught a cold and the Farmer decides to tuck him up in the house to recover.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors supersize tiny air sacs inside your lungs - your awesome Alveoli! And its fingers on buzzers in Ouchology - who will get snotted?

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: A new sloth bear has major lung issues, and a gator breaks out of restraints in an exam.

programme.title: The Mysterious Benedict Society
programme.desc: After seeing the adults acting strangely, the kids spring into action. Curtain hosts a celebration.

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: When Lee Cullen stumbles upon a scheme to deliver a superweapon into the hands of a foreign power, her life as she knows it ends. To secure her future, John Kruger must "erase" her past, even if he becomes the next target.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Theres a big bang in the lab as the doctors show how genes make you who you are, and a new doctor joins the team! Meet two brand new patients and find out how to make a hole in your hand with a new body trick to try at home.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Zamasu And Black The Duos Mystery Deepens
programme.desc: Zamasus mind is wandering down a dark path. Goku and Whis think theyve solved the riddle regarding his and Blacks strength. His malice may be unnoticed, but Zamasus ill will is beginning to dismantle his innocent facade!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its Timmys birthday and the Flock have thrown a party for him. At first hes delighted by all the attention; but when the Flock become distracted and hes left with no-one to play with, he decides to entertain himself.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang meet up with famous ventriloquists to stop a dummy.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Grizz, Panda and Ice Bear receive a special box and discover its magical ability.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: In this song number, E shows us what one, two and more Es can do.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Operation Ouch! doctors explore your incredible teeth, showing everything from why theyre all different shapes, to what happens if you knock a tooth out and why you definitely want to get rid of plaque.

programme.title: Show Me The Honey!
programme.sub-title: Fartenheimer, the Water Cycle and 206 Bones
programme.desc: The five wanna-beekeepers harvest their honey, fill their jars and hit the road to Glasgow, for the Grand Finale of Show Me The Honey.

programme.title: My Family: Have A Unhappy Christmas
programme.desc: Bens efforts to buy Susans Christmas present get him into trouble, a risque photo from Ben and Susans wedding night gets printed on some presents, and a letter from The Palace means a change of holiday plans for everyone.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: The team returns to some of the most controversial myths - the myths that generated a truck load of angry fan mail - and puts them back under the microscope.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Leeds to help the Seals family, who are desperate to sell up and downsize. But with a house bursting with years of clutter, this seems like a pipe dream unless Phil can convince the family to be brutal with mess.

programme.title: My Family: Have A Unhappy Christmas
programme.desc: Bens efforts to buy Susans Christmas present get him into trouble, a risque photo from Ben and Susans wedding night gets printed on some presents, and a letter from The Palace means a change of holiday plans for everyone.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Patsy and Edina go moshing at a Marilyn Manson concert. The following morning Eddy finds an attractive young man in her garden, could he be the man of her dreams?

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: The council issues Charlie with an ultimatum - either he moves his car from the Scheppers footpath or they will tow it away.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Protect The Supreme Kai Gowasu Destroy Zamasu!
programme.desc: Supreme Kai Gowasu is in grave danger! Now that gods are involved, Zamasus treachery isnt a mortal matter anymore. Beerus will have to take matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun dreams of a life in the fast lane. When Shirley lands upon something that could make his wish come true he cant believe his luck. The only obstacle that stands in his way is the rest of the Flock.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Dancer Maddie Ziegler needs help with a haunted studio.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: The Bears work as short-order cooks in a giants diner.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Q sings I Need U, but she cant do it on her own, so unwilling U lends a hand. This episode introduces the letter Q, the pair QU and the words quack, quiz, quick and quit.

programme.title: Know It Alls: History
programme.desc: Youngster Eleni and comedian Gen Fricker take on a trip through time as they explore the high seas with facts about Australian Migration, to be declared the Captain of the High Seas.

programme.title: The Ancient World Greece
programme.desc: Alexander the Great changed the face of ancient Greece forever when he began a campaign leading Greek armies to conquer the Persian Empire. We will look at how access to Egyptian innovations, produce and skills shaped Greece.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil is in Leeds to help the Seals family, who are desperate to sell up and downsize. But with a house bursting with years of clutter, this seems like a pipe dream unless Phil can convince the family to be brutal with mess.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie do a little painting and detonating when they attempt to blow wide open a home improvement myth and, can you manipulate someones mind remotely?

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels up to Queensbury Yorkshire to help retired teacher Mary, whose country cottage has lost its charm. Widowed and with her children having flown the nest, the house has become too big and expensive for Mary to keep.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Leaked Ukraine peace plan confuses allies and emboldens Russia. Is this the death knell for Ukraine? Plus as MAGA devotee Marjorie Taylor Greene quits Congress, does Trump have a new bestie in Zohran Mamdani? (Final for 2025)

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Make Up Your Mind Upsy Daisy
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy is singing in the garden when the ball bounces along and comes to a rest beside her. Upsy Daisy cant make up her mind whether to sing or play with the ball.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop wants to see a real dinosaur so he decides to look for one in the town square. He is disappointed he cant find a single one so his friends come up with a clever plan to help Bop see a dinosaur.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel Follows The Rules At The Pool
programme.desc: Daniel and Prince Wednesday are splashing by the slides at the Neighborhood pool. After Daniel runs and slips, he remembers the rules and stays safe playing at the pool.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: All of Peppas town are excited to meet Mr Potato when he comes to open a new sports centre in town.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer thinks the future has arrived when he takes delivery of his new high tech farmyard control module but when the gadget malfunctions, Bitzer is left wishing for his old whistle.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The Wise Old Elf fears an alien invasion after a presumed shooting star lands in the Little Kingdom.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa receives an invite to Candy Cats birthday party, but a double decker bus arrives, this is where the party is! The bus goes to the playground and even the beach. Its the best party ever!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes inadvertently start a massive roar off with all the other Vegesaurs.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Whilst Dad searches for a faulty wire Cosima and Big Lizard play tag in the ship and accidentally break Big Lizards bath bed! Now where will he sleep? And wheres that pesky wire?

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Abi and Luke meet Ben, a friendly and helpful nurse! Luke uses craft materials to make his own stethoscope, and Jemima visits Dr Kiya at hospital for an x-ray! Through The Windows, we see more medical workers in an animation.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When Drews dance partner is unable to perform at the school talent show, the Dream Factory Crew equips Jonathan with programmed dancing shoes to act as a replacement. But the shoes go haywire!

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Lollipop Swap
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay think they have broken Nanas lollipop stick, they decide to make her a new one. But how can they make sure Nana likes it?

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie makes hair washing fun by discovering some thinking tricks as part of the bath time routine.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: The Bananas love the nursery rhyme about the cow that jumped over the moon. They even think it really happened.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles for a fun musical adventure all about emotions! Sing along to "If Youre Happy and You Know It." Lachy feels sad when Wags chews his socks, but luckily Dorothy has a great idea!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Kana wants to speed fast enough to turn her electric crackle a bright red. Thomas and the other engines help building a long, straight, express track so she can achieve her goal.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family go on a walk through the forests where they meet all their favourite fairytale characters.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes must teach a lost baby BokChoydactyl how to fly so it can return to its parents. Unfortunately baby Bokchoydactyls are terrible flyers.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crews favourite car racing movie series, The Quick and the Curious, invites fans to make their own racing movie, with the best entry being shown on TV before the real movie airs.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: When a floating garbage patch endangers a flock of pelicans and other sea creatures, the Octonauts and the birds work together to clean it up.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are hungry but dont know what to eat so they delve into Duggees cookbook and learn how to complete a recipe together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Kenji hears that he must travel home to Japan alone, he gets scared and tries to hide. So, Thomas sets out to find him.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners plant a pizza shaped herb garden to create the ultimate pizzas!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles on a journey to outer space with their Wiggly friend, Astronaut Buddy! From counting to singing about what astronauts eat in space, its a learning adventure thats out of this world!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Oh, no! George has lost Mr Dinosaur! Maybe the police can help George find him.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosima and Big Lizard have a camping sleepover with a friendly little crab. In the morning, their new friend is missing, but why?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When the cadets create animals out of rubbish theyve cleaned from the beach, they dub them trash pets and inspire other beachgoers to make their own, but things get out of hand and their treasure becomes trash once more.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Pirate Robot seeks help when Night Ninja steals his hat. When Pirate Robot is left out of the PJs plans, he tries to help anyway and onlymakes the siuation much worse!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington opens Windsor Gardens first ever pet hotel when he has Lucky to stay over.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistles birthday has come around again and hes not happy. He does not want a birthday party but everything has been prepared. Poor Gaston the ladybird has never had a birthday party...

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi uses Toymans Do-Over remote until she perfects her jump!

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Makka Pakka is washing the ball when his Uff-uff blows right away. It falls into Upsy Daisys bed.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: It is autumn in Hoopla and Jango is having trouble sweeping up all the leaves. So Bop turns Jangos vacuum cleaner into a leaf blower which accidentally blows leaves and dirt all over Jangos friends.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel is at his first swim class, hes a little nervous to put his face in the water. His swim teacher, Queen Sara, reassures him that with a grown-up, he is safe at the pool.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle takes Peppa and her friends on a train ride where they must tick off what they see on their activity sheets.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When one of the pigs attempts to make friends with Timmy, his cohort evict him as punishment for un-pig-like behaviour. The sheep take him into the barn and attempt to transform him into the epitome of porcine sophistication.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nannys magic license is out of date and in order to get a new one she must pass a test, set by the Wise Old Elf.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and friends are at Penny Polar Bears house for a movie night. But before they can watch it, the children need to decide where to sit, which popcorn to eat and take a toilet break too.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Minty gets a birds-eye view of the Valley after being flung onto the back of a Baby BokChoydactyl.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Crab And Urchin
programme.desc: Barnacles and Kwazii investigate a disruption on a nearby reef: a Carrier Crab and the Urchin who lives on its shell just cant seem to get along.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Pola has forgotten to buy the meat for the family barbecue so, to avoid the barbecue being postponed, Tish proposes they hunt for vegetables for the barbecue instead.

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Abi and Matt meet Mara, a volunteer from the State Emergency Service! We learn about the SES uniform and equipment and SES worker, Dan, helps the toys after a big storm. Through The Windows, we see more SES workers in an animation.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Its an epic game of "Find the Flag" - and the winner gets to open the mystery box of presents that Drew and Jonathans mom brought back from her business trip.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Maxs Friend
programme.desc: When Max the cat leaves the garden in the middle of a game, the boys are shocked to learn she might have other friends! They find clues to try and find where Max has gone.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie prepares for a visit to the dentist by learning about the special tools, what the dentist does and how to relax in the big chair.

programme.title: Bananas In Pyjamas
programme.desc: Tonight is story night. Thats when the Teddies visit the Bananas and read a story.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come along and join the Wiggly fun, count to twenty with Caterina, and then dive into some creative craft fun as you discover whats in the craft box today!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Thomas and Kana ignore the needs of their engines, they end up exhausted and unable to complete their deliveries.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its time for playgroup! Today Peppa and her friends are deciding what they might like to be when they grow up.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Wasabi cracks his tooth on a Lava Nut so Ginger comes up with some creative but unsuccessful ways to extract it, until Wasabi accidentally solves his own problem.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew comes together to help Mels father Mikisew when he needs a new idea for his Art and Music Festival art piece. A giant marimba is created to make a fresh and exciting art/music installation.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Sea Sponge
programme.desc: Examining a sick sea sponge, Peso is surprised to discover that all sorts of creatures live inside it, treating it like a hotel, a behaviour known as commensalism.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels are frustrated because they feel that theyve exhausted their toys and theres nothing left to play with, but Duggee teaches them that they can always use their imagination!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Ruths new car, Cleo, takes to the rails to race Thomas, she soon discovers why she is designed to stick to the roads.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the junior gardeners get "buzzy" making hotels for native bees in the garden.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Come along and count to one hundred with The Wiggles, then explore different ways to greet someone. Youre invited to sing and dance to In the Wiggles World join in on this fun Wiggle and Learn adventure!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Dr Brown Bear comes to visit the playgroup and teach all of the children what to do when theres been an accident.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Cosimas so excited to tell Big Lizard about her life on Earth that she doesnt realise he has something exciting to say to her.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: When Pounce falls in the lagoon and gets covered in seaweed, the other cadets mistake him for a swamp monster, and decide they have to capture it.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.sub-title: The Power Of Mystery Mountain Part 1
programme.desc: Mystery Mountain breaks out of its dimension and floats over the city.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Keeps Up With The Kamalis
programme.desc: Paddington Judy and Jonathan learn that playing with your neighbours is more fun than trying to outdo them even if Toq keeps copying their ideas!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly invites Ben on the annual Royal Fairy Picnic. King Thistle hopes there wont be a repeat of last years magical jelly flood.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird is forced to hang back because Vans too dangerous!

programme.title: Keating
programme.desc: The Keating prime ministership: covering the road to a Republic, repointing the continent to Asia, the Redfern Speech and embracing Mabo; compulsory superannuation and blowing budget surpluses to climb out of recession.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget, James and Catherine hear from Joel Edgerton and William H Macy about new film Train Dreams, Zak Hepburn on Wicked For Good, also pot plant tips from Tammy Huynh, plus Tony McEvoy, Darren Lehmann and Alice Zaslavsky.

Sarah Ferguson is in Canberra for the final sitting week of the parliamentary year, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland and Jacob Greber.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

Sarah Ferguson is in Canberra for the final sitting week of the parliamentary year, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland and Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Culture By Design
programme.desc: Design has the power to bring people together, solve local challenges, and foster shared experiences. Discover how community influences design with stories from Mumbai, Central Java and Yogyakarta.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Ros Childs brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Play On
programme.desc: Connor OLeary, a Cronulla surfer who now surfs for Japan. Pasifika rugby league players on their connection to their homeland. And Gronya Somerville, a badminton player exploring her ties to Chinese aristocracy.

Sarah Ferguson is in Canberra for the final sitting week of the parliamentary year, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland and Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Spies In The Outback
programme.desc: As the Cold War enters the 70s, it becomes clear Pine Gap is really a spy base with eyes on the Soviets, and its putting Alice Springs in the nuclear crosshairs. Rumours swirl about how far the US will go to keep the secret.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Award winning filmmaker, Kaytetye man, Warwick Thornton has three people warring inside him: director, writer, cinematographer: but one must always win. In the searing beauty of Alice Springs, we witness the struggles.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: The ABS releases its first full monthly inflation figures. Kirsten Aiken and The Business team break it all down with reaction and analysis from economists and the market.
